thread.title: Debbie Harry wears crown to the ELLE Style Awards | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Debbie Harry wears crown to the ELLE Style Awards | Daily Mail Online

author: Ryan Smith For Mailonline
title: Debbie Harry wears crown to the ELLE Style Awards | Daily Mail Online
text: Buy now After posing solo on the red carpet, the rock star - who was named Style Icon at the event - removed her crown and as she joined Blondie co-founder and guitarist Chris Stein for more shots. For his part, Chris looked equally rock 'n' roll, stepping out in an all-black ensemble and dark glasses as he toted an SLR camera. Back in November, Debbie caused quite a stir when she arrived at the Q Awards wearing a form-fitting black dress, over which she draped a jacket - emblazoned with the words 'stop f***ing the planet'. Strike a pose: She posed up a storm as she commanded the attention of the photographers Marching to the beat of her own drum: Debbie has long been known for defiantly forgoing conventional fashion in favour of displaying her own stylish flair Retaining an unconventional theme throughout, the Rapture singer rocked a pair of clear, plastic-framed glasses, which featured large dark triangles over each lens. Standing tall in a pair of black suede heel-less wedges, the evergreen star rounded out her eye-catching ensemble with a metallic silver handbag. In 2015, the star admitted to MailOnline that she doesn't put up old photographs of herself around her home, because it reminds her how much she has aged. We're in a band: She later removed her crown to pose with Blondie co-founder Chris Stein Black to basics: The drummer looked equally rock 'n'roll in his black ensemble of choice ‘It’s horrifying seeing photos of myself from when I was younger,’ she said. ‘It makes me realise how old I’ve become. I still get really surprised when I see myself and realise I’m not young any more. ‘Ageing is scary, and it’s particularly hard for women because we depend on our looks so much, especially if you’re in the public eye.’ She added: ‘I don’t have any photos of myself on the walls at home because I would find that strange... that’s where I escape.’ Bold statement: Back in November, she made a bold fashion statement as she arrived at London's Q Awards wearing a jacket emblazoned with the words 'stop f***ing the planet' In case you missed it...: Debbie was sure to open her jacket wide to share her message ELLE STYLE AWARDS 2017 - WINNERS WOMAN OF THE YEAR BRITISH BRAND OF THE YEAR Christopher Bailey, Burberry
